column4: libmpeg2 is what it's attempting to use to play the videos. What would be used in it's place? Anyone?
The only reason I'm not using VLC is because the video is scrambled in it, too.
Also, the buffer keeps making the audio skip.
It tried to use the mpeg2 software, but I'm not sure what format the disk is. It's a DVD.
That's as much as I can tell you right now, because it won't open it long enough to show any file information.
hmm, have you got all the dvd codecs installed?
I have all of the DVD codecs that I could find installed.
hmm, I really don't know. Tried mplayer or rip the dvds to your harddrive and see if the issue is there
Thanks for the help, but I finally figured out what was wrong.
asked you if you had all the libraries installed :)
libdvdcss never came up in the package manager, so I didn't know where it was.
Had to search around a bit.
you can just install ubuntu-restriced-extras iirc that installs libdvdcss2
I already had that installed, and it still wouldn't work.
